attributes.action: People who have paid in to the National Health service for many years are not refused treatment on the basis of cost
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
People who have paid their NI contributions for for many years are being refused essential drugs and treatments on the basis of 'cost', while others who are new to this country and have not yet contributed are receiving treatment.
If after paying in to an Insurance company it refused to pay a claim on the basis of 'Can't afford to pay out' it would be ILLEGAL and they could be SUED. Why then should the government force us to pay through our wages and then refuse treatment/drugs to the sick and dying on the basis of cost.

reasons: Statements that don't actually request any action
